info.header: Nokia Siemens RNC RN60_1 STM_1_IF STM1 measurement dump
info.csv_title: Nokia Siemens RNC RN60_1 STM_1_IF STM1 measurement dump

kpi_info.title: period_duration
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: REG_BBE
kpi_info.use: Regenerator section background block errors. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. B1 byte in the section overhead header (SOH) is used for regenerator section error monitoring using the Bit Interleaved Parity 8 (BIP-8) code, in an even parity. The BIP-8 is computed over all the bits of the previous STM frame after scrambling, and is placed in byte B1 of the current frame before scrambling. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (STM-1 frame). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: REG_ES
kpi_info.use: Regenerator section errored seconds. This is the number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the regeneration section (B1) errors and LOS or LOF events. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: REG_SES
kpi_info.use: Regenerator section severely errored seconds. The number of one second periods which contained >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by the Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. The default value of the threshold is 30 %. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the regenerator section (B1) errors and regenerator section LOF/LOS events. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect.

kpi_info.title: REG_UAS
kpi_info.use: Regenerator section is unavailable for a number of seconds (ITU-T G.826). The period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: MUX_UAS
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section unavailable seconds at the near end A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updatingthe counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: NE_MUX_BBE
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section background block errors at the near end. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. B2 byte in the section overhead header (SOH) is used for multiplex section error monitoring using Bit Interleaved Parity 24 (BIP-24) code, in an even parity. The BIP-24 is computed over all the bits of the previous STM frame, excluding RSOH, and is placed in byte B2 of the current frame before scrambling. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (STM-1 frame, excluding RSOH). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: NE_MUX_ES
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section errored seconds at the near end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are multiplex section (B2) errors and MS-AIS. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: NE_MUX_SES
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section severely errored seconds at the near end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are multiplex section (B2) errors and MS-AIS. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. During the SES condition, counter NE_MUX_ES M513C12 is also incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH1_UAS
kpi_info.use: Path termination section unavailable seconds at the near end. A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH1_BBE
kpi_info.use: Path termination section background block errors at the near end. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. B3 byte in the higher order path overhead header (HO-POH) is used for path termination section error monitoring using Bit Interleaved Parity 8 (BIP-8) code, in an even parity. The BIP-8 is computed over all the bits of the previous virtual container (VC-4) and is placed in byte B3 of the current frame. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (virtual container). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH1_ES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section errored second at the near end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (B3) errors, AU-AIS, LOP, PLM, TIM, UNEQ and LCD. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH1_SES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section severely errored seconds at the near end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (B3) errors, AU-AIS, LOP, PLM, TIM, UNEQ and LCD. In this case the block means virtual container. During the SES condition, counter NE_PATH1_ES M513C16 is also incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH2_UAS
kpi_info.use: Path termination section unavailable seconds at the near end. A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH2_BBE
kpi_info.use: Path termination section background block errors at the near end An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. B3 byte in the higher order path overhead header (HO-POH) is used for path termination section error monitoring using Bit Interleaved Parity 8 (BIP-8) code, in an even parity. The BIP-8 is computed over all the bits of the previous virtual container (VC-4) and is placed in byte B3 of the current frame. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (virtual container). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH2_ES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section errored seconds at the near end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (B3) errors, AU-AIS, LOP, PLM, TIM, UNEQ and LCD. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH2_SES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section severely errored seconds at the near end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (B3) errors, AU-AIS, LOP, PLM, TIM, UNEQ and LCD. In this case the block means virtual container. During the SES condition, counter NE_PATH2_ES M513C20 is also incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH3_UAS
kpi_info.use: Path termination section unavailable seconds at the near end. A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH3_BBE
kpi_info.use: Path termination section background block errors at the near end. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. B3 byte in the higher order path overhead header (HO-POH) is used for path termination section error monitoring using Bit Interleaved Parity 8 (BIP-8) code, in an even parity. The BIP-8 is computed over all the bits of the previous virtual container (VC-4) and is placed in byte B3 of the current frame. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (virtual container). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH3_ES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section errored seconds at the near end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (B3) errors, AU-AIS, LOP, PLM, TIM, UNEQ and LCD. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: NE_PATH3_SES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section severely errored seconds at the near end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (B3) errors, AU-AIS, LOP, PLM, TIM, UNEQ and LCD. In this case the block means virtual container. During the SES condition,counter NE_PATH3_ES M513C24 is also incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_MUX_UAS
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section unavailable seconds at the Far End. A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: FE_MUX_BBE
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section background block errors at the far end. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. M1 byte conveys the count of errored blocks which is calculated by the far end from its receiving blocks by using B2 bytes at multiplexer level. B2 bytes are the bytes allocated for a multiplex section error monitoring function which is Bit Interleaved Parity 24 (BIP-24) code using even parity. The BIP-24 is computed over all bits of the previous STM frame exluding RSOH and is placed in byte B2 of the current frame. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (STM-1 frame excluding the RSOH). The counter is not updated during SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: FE_MUX_ES
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section errored second at the far end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are multiplex section (M1) errors and MS-RDI. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_MUX_SES
kpi_info.use: Multiplex section severely errored seconds at the far end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are multiplex section (M1) errors and MS-RDI. In this case the block means STM-1 frame. During SES condition also counter FE_MUX_ES M513C28 is incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH1_UAS
kpi_info.use: Path termination section unavailable seconds at the far end. A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH1_BBE
kpi_info.use: Path termination section background block errors at the far end. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. G1 byte in the section overhead header (SOH) is used for path termination section error monitoring using Bit Interleaved Parity 8 (BIP-8) code, in an even parity. The BIP-8 is computed over all the bits of the previous virtual container (VC-4) and is placed in byte B3 of the current frame. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (virtual container). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH1_ES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section errored seconds at the far end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are path termination section (G1) errors and HP-RDI. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH1_SES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section severely errored seconds at the far end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (G1) errors and HP-RDI. In this case the block means virtual container. During the SES condition also counter FE_PATH1_ES M513C32 is incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH2_UAS
kpi_info.use: Path termination section unavailable seconds at the far end. A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH2_BBE
kpi_info.use: Path termination section background block errors at the far end. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. G1 byte in the section overhead header (SOH) is used for path termination section error monitoring using Bit Interleaved Parity 8 (BIP-8) code, in an even parity. The BIP-8 is computed over all bits of the previous virtual container (VC-4) and is placed in byte B3 of the current frame. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (virtual container). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH2_ES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section errored seconds at the far end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (G1) errors and HP-RDI. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH2_SES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section severely errored seconds at the far end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (G1) errors and HP- RDI. In this case the block means virtual container. During the SES condition counter FE_PATH2_ES M513C36 is also incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH3_UAS
kpi_info.use: Path termination section unavailable seconds at the far end. A period of unavailable time begins at the start of ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the unavailable time. A new period of available time begins at the start of ten consecutive non-SES events. These ten seconds are considered to be part of the available time. UPDATED:The counter is updated after ten consecutive severely errored second (SES) events are detected. These ten seconds are included in the counter. Updating the counter is stopped when ten consecutive non-SES events are detected. These ten seconds are not included in the counter.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH3_BBE
kpi_info.use: Path termination section background block errors at the far end. An errored block is a block in which one or more bits have an error. G1 byte in the section overhead header (SOH) is used for path termination section error monitoring using Bit Interleaved Parity 8 (BIP-8) code, in an even parity. The BIP-8 is computed over all the bits of the previous virtual container (VC-4) and is placed in byte B3 of the current frame. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when one or more bit errors are detected in a block (virtual container). The counter is not updated during the SES and UAS conditions.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH3_ES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section errored seconds at the far end. The number of seconds with one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters are obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (G1) errors and HP-RDI. In this case the block means virtual container. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains one or more errored blocks or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.

kpi_info.title: FE_PATH3_SES
kpi_info.use: Path termination section severely errored seconds at the far end. The number of one second periods which contain >= threshold errored blocks or at least one defect. The threshold can be handled by Exchange terminal configuration handling YAN-MML. At the end of each one second interval the contents of the counters may be obtained by the relevant managed objects. The objects are the path termination section (G1) errors and HP-RDI. In this case the block means virtual container. The path termination section is one of the SDH layers (regeneration, multiplex and path) (ITU-T G.707). During the SES condition counter FE_PATH3_ES M513C40 is also incremented. UPDATED:The counter is incremented when a second contains errored blocks more or equal to that in the defined threshold or at least one defect. The counter is not updated during the UAS condition.
